Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and faint traces of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.102-3)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87612) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87612)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 114 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
